clinical_study.brief_title: Adjuvant Treatment of EC Followed by Taxane +/- Carboplatin in Triple-Negative Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Epirubicin-Cyclophosphamide Followed by Taxanes or Taxanes Plus Carboplatin in Triple-Negative Breast Cancerï¼šA Prospective, Randomized, Phase III Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: To compare disease-free survival (DFS) rate of adjuvant chemotherapy epirubicin-cyclophosphamide followed by weekly paclitaxel or docetaxel (EC-T), or weekly paclitaxel or docetaxel-carboplatin (EC-TCb) in triple-negative breast cancer.

detailed_description.textblock: This study plans to enroll triple-negative breast cancer patients who have complete tumor removal. Patients are randomized to receive either EC-wP/T or EC-wP/TCb adjuvant chemotherapy. For triple-negative breast cancer, a subgroup of triple-negative breast cancer has DNA repairement deficiency and adding carboplatin to paclitaxel may improve DFS on the basis of weekly paclitaxel adjuvant chemotherapy.

primary_outcome.description: to compare the disease-free survival among two treatment arms

secondary_outcome.description: to compare the overall survival among two treatment arms
to compare the neutropenia fever among two treatment arms
to compare the grade 3-4 side effects among two treatment arms

arm_group.description: Epirubicin plus Cyclophosphamide followed by Paclitaxel or Docetaxel
Epirubicin plus Cyclophosphamide followed by Paclitaxel or Docetaxel + Carboplatin

intervention.description: Epirubicin 90mg/m2, d1, q3w*4 Cyclophosphamide: 600mg/m2, d1, q3w*4
Paclitaxel: 80mg/m2, d1,d8,d15, q4w*4 Carboplatin AUC=2, d1,d8,d15, q4w*4 or Docetaxel: 75mg/m2,d1,q3w*4 plus Carboplatin AUC=5-6, d1, q3w*4
